de.fzi.replica.app.msg
Enum Message

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Enum<Message>
      de.fzi.replica.app.msg.Message
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Message>
public enum Message
extends java.lang.Enum<Message>

This enumeration defines all signal types of the primary messaging channel of a ReplicaOntologyApplication.

The content of a message is determined by its unique type ID. Another way would be to use only REQUESTS and RESPONSES and track a state in the client (e.g. whether a SOID REQUEST has been made) and behave according to that. But this way is much easier and sufficient for now.

Version:
0.1, 21.07.2011 TODO too heavy and useless strings
Author:
Jan Novacek novacek@fzi.de, jannvck@gmail.com

Enum Constant Summary
ADD_TO_GROUP
          Client requests adding an ontology to a specified group.
REQUEST_ADD
          A new shared object ID will be requested when a client adds an ontology.
REQUEST_GROUPS
          Will list all available groups.
REQUEST_ONTOIDS
          Will list all ontology IDs.
REQUEST_ONTOIDS_GROUP
          Will list all ontology IDs in one or more groups.
REQUEST_RETRY
          If a previously sent message has not been responded to and timed out this type of message is sent along with the message ID.
REQUEST_SOIDS
          If a client needs shared object IDs of ontologies this type of request is made.
RESPONSE_ADD_OK
          New shared object ID will come along with this response.
RESPONSE_DENIED
          Deprecated. Introduce fail messages for each request type.

          Deprecated. Introduce fail messages for each request type.
RESPONSE_FAIL_NOT_FOUND
          Deprecated. Introduce fail messages for each request type. Also: Not sure about this (response could be ok but without result)

Enum Constant Detail

REQUEST_ADD

public static final Message REQUEST_ADD
A new shared object ID will be requested when a client adds an ontology.

RESPONSE_ADD_OK

public static final Message RESPONSE_ADD_OK
New shared object ID will come along with this response.

REQUEST_SOIDS

public static final Message REQUEST_SOIDS
If a client needs shared object IDs of ontologies this type of request is made. No argument means that all IDs will be listed.
Optionally an ontology group can be specified as parameter.

RESPONSE_SOIDS_OK

public static final Message RESPONSE_SOIDS_OK

RESPONSE_SOIDS_FAIL_NOT_FOUND

public static final Message RESPONSE_SOIDS_FAIL_NOT_FOUND

RESPONSE_FAIL

public static final Message RESPONSE_FAIL
Deprecated. Introduce fail messages for each request type.
If an unknown error occurred and the request can not be satisfied.

RESPONSE_FAIL_NOT_FOUND

public static final Message RESPONSE_FAIL_NOT_FOUND
Deprecated. Introduce fail messages for each request type. Also: Not sure about this (response could be ok but without result)

RESPONSE_DENIED

public static final Message RESPONSE_DENIED
Deprecated. Introduce fail messages for each request type.
If the requested action was denied for an unknown reason.
